title: Research and select headless CMS for content management
description: Evaluate CMS options for portfolio content management: 1) Sanity - customizable, real-time collaboration, 2) Strapi - open source, self-hostable, 3) Storyblok - visual editor, good for marketers, 4) Decap CMS (Netlify CMS) - git-based, free, integrated with Netlify, 5) Contentful - enterprise-grade. Document pros/cons and recommend best fit.
notes: For a portfolio site, consider: ease of use, cost, Netlify integration, content modeling flexibility, and learning curve. Decap CMS is free and git-based which works well with Netlify. Sanity offers more advanced features.

title: Integrate selected CMS with Next.js project
description: Set up the chosen CMS with: 1) Content types for Projects, Blog Posts, About content, 2) API integration for content fetching, 3) Preview mode for draft content, 4) Webhooks for content updates. Configure for Netlify deployment.
notes: CMS integration should support ISR/SSG for optimal performance. Document content schema and API usage.

title: Configure Netlify Forms with Next.js workaround
description: Implement Netlify Forms for contact/inquiry forms following OpenNext documentation: 1) Create public/__forms.html for deploy-time form detection, 2) Add form with data-netlify=true and hidden fields, 3) Create client-side form component with fetch POST to /__forms.html, 4) Handle submission states (success, error, pending). Reference: https://opennext.js.org/netlify/forms
notes: Netlify Forms requires static HTML workaround for Next.js because modern Next.js doesn't generate static HTML. The form detection file in public/ is scanned at deploy time.

title: Add spam protection to inquiry forms
description: Implement spam protection for forms: 1) Honeypot field (bot-field), 2) Optional reCAPTCHA v3, 3) Rate limiting, 4) Form validation. Test form submission and spam blocking.
notes: Netlify provides built-in spam filtering. Honeypot fields are effective and invisible to users. reCAPTCHA adds extra protection.

title: [Week 1] Update Next.js to use OpenNext adapter for Netlify
description: Remove static export mode and configure for modern Netlify Next.js runtime. This includes: 1) Remove output:'export' from next.config.js, 2) Update netlify.toml publish dir to .next, 3) Enable skew protection with NETLIFY_NEXT_SKEW_PROTECTION=true env var, 4) Add experimental.useDeploymentId for Next.js < 14.1.4. Reference: https://docs.netlify.com/build/frameworks/framework-setup-guides/nextjs/overview/
notes: Research shows Netlify's OpenNext adapter automatically handles SSR, ISR, middleware, image optimization, and caching. Static export mode prevents using modern Next.js features.
